title: 16 of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as adapted by the Further
heading: 4. Article 14 of the Principal Scheme is amended-
text_raw:
4. Article 14 of the Principal Scheme is amended- 

(a) 

in subparagraph 3(b) by substituting “€25,000” for “€19,000”, 
and 

(b) by deleting paragraph (7), and 

(c) by substituting for paragraph (9) the following:- 

“(9) notwithstanding paragraph (8) a student is eligible for a 
fee grant if he or she is pursuing a postgraduate course and the 
applicant’s reckonable income meets the qualifying conditions 
for the special rate as specified in Schedule 1 and Schedule 2. 
Notwithstanding paragraph (8) a tuition student is eligible for a 
fee grant if he or she is pursuing a postgraduate course and the 
applicant’s reckonable income meets the qualifying conditions 
for the special rate as specified in Schedule 1 and Schedule 2.”

heading: 6. Article 27 of the Principal Scheme is amended by inserting after
text_raw:
6. Article 27 of the Principal Scheme is amended by inserting after 

paragraph (5) the following: 

“(6) The total value of the Maintenance Grant that would otherwise be 
payable to an applicant under this Article and Schedule 3 in respect of the 
period January to May 2024 shall be increased by the total amount specified in 
Schedule 3A. Payment of this additional amount shall be made on a pro rata 
basis in respect of an applicant’s attendance on an approved course in an 
approved institution during this period.”

9. Article 37 of the Principal Scheme is amended by substituting for

“(2) The awarding authority, or other relevant paying authority referred

text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of this Scheme is to amend the Student Grant Scheme 2023 to 
provide for changes to the rate of the Student Maintenance Grant, the extension 
of eligibility for a Maintenance Grant to Postgraduate students and to increase 
the specified sum allowable for eligibility to apply for a grant when in receipt 
of a postgraduate research award where the stipend portion does not exceed a 
certain amount by €6,000, all from January 2024.
